Massachusetts General Laws Chapter 218,.proposition: Jurisdiction over this matter is proper in the Chelsea District Court pursuant to Massachusetts General Laws Chapter 218, Section 21.

Massachusetts General Laws Chapter 186,.proposition: Massachusetts General Laws Chapter 186, Section 14 provides that a landlord must maintain premises in habitable condition, including providing adequate security measures.

Pugh v. Holmes, 253 Mass 115 (1925).proposition: Case law in Massachusetts, such as Pugh v. Holmes, 253 Mass 115 (1925), holds that a breach of the covenant of quiet enjoyment occurs when a landlord fails to address security issues that affect a tenant's enjoyment of the property.
